channel.title: PGP keys deleted after workstation restart
channel.description: Greetings, I'm having an odd issue with my pgp keys and GnuPG. Sometimes, after workstation restart, all my PGP keys are removed. I'm using the software as it came default with whonix.

item.title: PGP keys deleted after workstation restart
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Please provide steps for reproduction.

Whonix – 1 May 20

Bug Reports and Software Development

How to Report (Security) Bugs in the Whonix ™ Operating System. Software development cycle, patches, and responsiveness to feedback.

Read full topic
item.source: PGP keys deleted after workstation restart

item.title: PGP keys deleted after workstation restart
item.dc:creator: Hon
item.description:
No, I’m running persistent mode, on virtual box. I’ve been running whonix 15 since it’s release, didn’t have this problem until recently.

Read full topic
item.source: PGP keys deleted after workstation restart

item.title: PGP keys deleted after workstation restart
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Only that or also other files missing? Create some other files please and check. Using live mode?

Whonix – 5 Mar 20

Whonix ™ Live Mode - Stop Persistent Malware

Whonix ™ Live Mode. Read-only mode. Make all writes go to non-persistent memory (RAM) instead of the hard disk. This is NOT an anti-forensics feature!

If using that, well, that would not be a surprise. That would be expected. Boot into persistent mode then.

Read full topic
item.source: PGP keys deleted after workstation restart
